message.content:
cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.GT, cs.SI, cs.CG. 

The paper deals with the problem of recoloring a graph in a distributed setting, which is a problem in distributed computing (cs.DC). The paper also discusses the length of the recoloring schedule, which is related to graph theory (cs.GT). The use of extra colors to make recoloring easier is a technique in graph coloring (cs.DS). The paper also mentions the LOCAL model of distributed computing, which is a specific model of computation (cs.SI). Finally, the paper deals with specific graph classes such as trees and toroidal grids, which is related to computational geometry (cs.CG).
